content:
Sure, I can give you some examples of the famous performances that took place at the Waldorf Theatre. The venue was a popular spot for premieres of Broadway musicals and plays, and many well-known performers got their start on its stage, including:

- The operetta "The Desert Song" premiered at the Waldorf Theatre in 1926, and went on to become one of the most popular operettas of all time.

- "The Band Wagon," a musical comedy starring Fred Astaire and Cyd Charisse, premiered at the theater in 1931.

- "Pal Joey," a musical starring Gene Kelly, opened at the Waldorf Theatre in 1940.

- "Annie Get Your Gun," starring Ethel Merman, premiered at the theater in 1946.

- Judy Garland performed at the Waldorf Astoria Hotel's Empire Room in the 1950s, with many of her performances being televised.

- The venue was also known for hosting charity galas, political events, and awards ceremonies, like the Tony Awards.

These are just a few examples of the many renowned performances that took place at the Waldorf Theatre over the years. The venue was a significant fixture in the cultural scene of New York City for many decades.
